events.title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
events.description: The Berlin Wall was brought down, marking the end of the Cold War and the division between East and West Germany.

events.title: Construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza
events.description: The Great Pyramid was built as a tomb for the Pharaoh Khufu of the Fourth Dynasty of ancient Egypt.

events.title: Ghana Independence
events.description: Ghana becomes the first sub-Saharan African country to gain independence from European colonization, under the leadership of Kwame Nkrumah.

events.title: Nigerian Independence
events.description: Nigeria gains independence from British rule, becoming Africa's most populous independent nation.

events.title: Nigerian Civil War (Biafran War)
events.description: The Nigerian Civil War begins as Biafra attempts to establish an independent republic, leading to a devastating conflict lasting until 1970.

events.title: Algerian Independence
events.description: Algeria gains independence from France after a brutal eight-year war of independence.

events.title: Rwandan Genocide
events.description: Genocide against the Tutsi people in Rwanda results in an estimated 800,000 deaths over a 100-day period.

events.title: South African Apartheid Ends
events.description: Apartheid ends in South Africa with the election of Nelson Mandela as the country's first Black president.

events.title: Congo Independence
events.description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo gains independence from Belgium, followed by political crisis and civil conflict.

events.title: Kenyan Independence
events.description: Kenya gains independence from British colonial rule, with Jomo Kenyatta becoming the first president.

events.title: Ethiopian Revolution
events.description: Emperor Haile Selassie is overthrown, ending one of the world's oldest monarchies and leading to a period of communist rule.

events.title: Libyan Independence
events.description: Libya gains independence from Italy, becoming one of the first African nations to achieve independence after World War II.

events.title: First Liberian Civil War
events.description: Civil war breaks out in Liberia, lasting until 1997 and resulting in the deaths of over 200,000 people.

events.title: Angolan Independence
events.description: Angola gains independence from Portugal, followed by a prolonged civil war lasting until 2002.

events.title: Great African War Begins
events.description: The Second Congo War begins, involving nine African countries and resulting in over 5.4 million deaths by 2008.

events.title: Formation of the African Union
events.description: The African Union is established in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, replacing the Organization of African Unity.

events.title: First Olympic Games
events.description: The first recorded Olympic Games were held in Olympia, Greece.

events.title: Invention of the Printing Press
events.description: Johannes Gutenberg invents the movable-type printing press in Mainz, Germany, revolutionizing the spread of information.

events.title: Discovery of King Tutankhamun's Tomb
events.description: Howard Carter discovers the nearly intact tomb of Tutankhamun in Egypt's Valley of the Kings.

events.title: The Black Death Begins
events.description: The Black Death arrives in Venice, marking the start of a devastating pandemic in Europe.

events.title: Founding of the Mongol Empire
events.description: Genghis Khan unifies the Mongol tribes and establishes the largest contiguous land empire in history.

events.title: The Renaissance Begins
events.description: The Renaissance period begins in Florence, Italy, marking a rebirth of art, science, and classical learning.
